forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 9pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 35. Northwest wind 9 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 45. West wind 7 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the sun retreats beyond the horizon, Boston finds itself cloaked in a veil of clouds, hinting at the cool embrace of winter. This evening holds a slight chance of rain, though it seems the heavens may keep their offerings to a whisper, with temperatures dipping to a brisk 35 degrees. A northwest wind breathes through the streets, dancing at 9 to 15 mph, occasionally gusting with an exuberance that stirs the fallen leaves, making for an unsettling chill that sneaks beneath layers of clothing. 

Tomorrow promises a brighter outlook as the sun ascends, ushering in a day adorned with clear blue skies and a gentle warmth near 45 degrees. Such conditions invite the city’s dwellers outdoors; whether it be a quiet stroll along the Charles or a visit to your favorite café, the atmosphere will be refreshingly pleasant. Layer yourself sensibly—perhaps a cozy sweater beneath a sturdy jacket, complemented by a scarf to ward off the evening chill. As day transitions into night, the air may turn crisp, echoing the spirit of the season. Embrace this transitional time, for there is beauty in both the quiet dusk and the promise of a golden day ahead.
